subject: Re: [junit] Comparing two files on runtime
msgSnippet: ... JUnit doesn t have anything built-in to do this, but there are several third-party extensions that will. To test whether two files contents are
messageBody:
kavithask_98 wrote:
> Hi,
> After running unit test, the output generates an xml file which has
> say more than 300 lines.
> Now, I need to verify this with the expected xml file. Since, I have
> lot of testcases like this it is not possible to verify manually.
> Does Junit support this feature like comparing any two files checking
> for the difference and then if something is not matching, showing me
> the testcase and the lines due to which has failed.

JUnit doesn't have anything built-in to do this, but there are several
third-party extensions that will. To test whether two files' contents
are /identical/, use JUnit-Addons' FileAssert class
(http://junit-addons.sourceforge.net/junitx/framework/FileAssert.html).
In your case, though, it may be more appropriate to compare the files as
XML Documents. The XMLUnit class
(http://xmlunit.sourceforge.net/doc/org/custommonkey/xmlunit/XMLUnit.html)
has several utility methods that compare DOM document structures, with
varying degrees of strictness. Either one will save you a lot of time.
